greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Array:  row n shows the coefficients of the characteristic polynomial of the n-th principal submatrix of max{j mod i,  i mod j} (A204016).
comment: Let p(n)=p(n,x) be the characteristic polynomial of the n-th principal submatrix.  The zeros of p(n) are real, and they interlace the zeros of p(n+1).  See A204016 and A202605 for guides to related sequences.
reference: (For references regarding interlacing roots, see A202605.)
example: The 1st principal submatrix (ps) of A204016 is {{1}} (using Mathematica matrix notation), with p(1)=1-x and zero-set {1}.
The 2nd ps is {{0,1},{1,0}}, with p(2)=-1+x^2 and zero-set {-1,1}.
The interlace property is illustrated for the last two zero-sets by this chain:
mathematica: f[i_, j_] := Max[Mod[i, j], Mod[j, i]];
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_, Jan 10 2012
